channel.title: [Release] NoREpls Source - Version 1
channel.description:
Hey guys, as you may or may not know, I developed an application dubbed "NoREpls" for the purposes of teaching Windows reverse engineering as a side project. It's been a while since its debut here so I've decided to finally upload its source on my GitHub page here: https://github.com/NtRaiseHardError/NoREpls. The code currently contains the latest changes (part 6).
For those who are interested in the potential continuation of `edgyReggie`'s development adventures and the NoREpls series, please vote if you want to see more and/or leave a reply to suggest a relatively simple application.
[poll type=regular max=20 public=true close=2018-07-31T12:39:00.000Z] * yes plz * It's time to STOP [/poll]
For those who have just discovered its existence, have little to no experience in this and are interested, you can find the entirety of the 7-part series here: https://0x00sec.org/t/challenge-collection-reverse-engineering-and-crackme/3027.
kthxbye

item.title: [Release] NoREpls Source - Version 1
item.dc:creator: dtm
item.description:
This topic was automatically closed after 30 days. New replies are no longer allowed.

item.title: [Release] NoREpls Source - Version 1
item.dc:creator: dtm
item.description:
Hey guys, as you may or may not know, I developed an application dubbed “NoREpls” for the purposes of teaching Windows reverse engineering as a side project. It’s been a while since its debut here so I’ve decided to finally upload its source on my GitHub page here: https://github.com/NtRaiseHardError/NoREpls. The code currently contains the latest changes (part 6).

For those who are interested in the potential continuation of edgyReggie's development adventures and the NoREpls series, please vote if you want to see more and/or leave a reply to suggest a relatively simple application.

Click to view the poll.

For those who have just discovered its existence, have little to no experience in this and are interested, you can find the entirety of the 7-part series here: Challenge Collection: Reverse Engineering and CrackMe.

kthxbye
